'''''Lactifluus corrugis''''' (formerly '''''Lactarius corrugis'''''), commonly known as the '''corrugated-cap milky''',<ref name="Bessette 2009"/> is a species of [[fungus]] in the family [[Russulaceae]]. It was first described by American mycologist [[Charles Horton Peck]] in 1880.<ref name="Peck 1879"/>

==See also==
*[[List of Lactifluus species|List of ''Lactifluus'' species]]
